comments.content: Thanks Yves, I realise it was probably hand lettered still seems strangly familiar also.

I hunted through the Jaspert "Encyclopaedia" and about the only typeface that made me look twice at it was [Albertus](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518124711/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/albertus/), and it's not too close. I guess if I had to try to re-create this, that might be where I would start. The high-centered M with straight sides is not very common at all in serif fonts.

The typeface this reminds me most of is [Benguiat](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518124711/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/itc-benguiat/), probably because of the distinctive M. But Benguiat isn't really that close....
